subject: AI
title: Thumbs Up / Thumbs Down
description: Designing simple feedback mechanisms for AI outputs.

hook.text: ChatGPT's thumbs up/down buttons are the most important UI element in AI history. They generate millions of quality signals per day at zero cost.

buildup.text: Binary feedback (good/bad) is the simplest feedback mechanism. Low friction means high response rates. Even 5% of users rating gives you a massive quality signal.

discovery.text: Place feedback buttons directly below every AI output. Optionally add 'Why?' with pre-set categories: 'Inaccurate,' 'Not relevant,' 'Too long,' 'Offensive.' Structured reasons are more actionable.

twist.text: Positive feedback bias: users mostly rate when they're happy or very unhappy. The middle (mediocre responses) goes unrated. Account for this bias in your analysis.

climax.text: Track thumbs-down rate by feature, by time, and by query type. A rising thumbs-down rate is an early warning of quality degradation.

punchline.text: Two buttons. Infinite signal. Add them to every AI output.

quiz.question: What bias exists in thumbs up/down feedback?
options: Users mostly rate when very happy or very unhappy, leaving mediocre responses unrated
Thumbs down is always more common
There is no bias in binary feedback
